title: Bootnodes settings screen is useless
body:
### User Story

As a developer/user, I'd like to know which bootnodes are currently defined and used by the app and I'd like to specify my own bootnodes.

### Description

*Type*: Feature/Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: The current "Bootnodes settings" screen is useless because it does not give any information which bootnodes are used and adding a new bootnode does not suggest if it is used at all.

#### Expected behavior
When I open "Bootnodes settings" screen, I'd like to see the summary of enodes currently used as bootnodes. Also, if I add my own bootnodes, I'd like to see them in the summary as well. It should be possible to override default bootnodes completely as well.

#### Actual behavior
Currently, I don't know which bootnodes are used. I can add my own bootnode but there is no confirmation if it's used.

### Reproduction
[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- Go to Profile > Bootnodes
- Add a custom bootnode

### Solution
[comment]: # (Please summarise the solution and provide a task list on what needs to be fixed.)
*Summary*: 
- "Bottnodes settings" displays the current list of bootnodes from the config,
- When I add a custom bootnode, I'd like to see a confirmation that it's being used,
- I should be able to not only add a new bootnode but override existing ones (this is needed for people who don't want to advertise their nodes in the network because they use a private one for example).

### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
* Status version: 0.9.29
* Operating System: Android and iOS
